activities.loc: Br I Courtroom, 3rd Fl, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tamra L. Schott

records.addlTxt:
2:56 PM Defendant Tamra L. Schott in court.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court for Tamra L. Schott. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Svehlek states has new information that has been provided by ADA - would like PTC scheduled when ADA Pfeifer returns - possibly set for Jury Trial. Bond continued. adj. 02:58 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 11:30 am.

1:43 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Tamra L. Schott in court. Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court for Tamra L. Schott. Svehlek states case is not resolved and would like to set out. Bond continued. adj. 01:44 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

11:08  AM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Tamra L. Schott in court. Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court for Tamra L. Schott. State calls Oneida County Sheriff's Detective Sergeant Brian Barbour/sworn/direct by Pfeifer/witness identifies Defendant/continued direct by Pfeifer/cross by Svehlek/witness is excused. Court finds probable cause exists and binds Defendant over. Pfeifer states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Svehlek willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Pfeifer statement to Booking. Court directs Defendant to submit to Booking after Court. Bond continued. adj. 11:16 AM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:47 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tamra L. Schott in court.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court for Tamra L. Schott. 
In receipt, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing. Time limits waived.
Bail continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.
